recipes.title: Carrot and Date Salad with Gorgonzola Dressing
recipes.attribution: Georgeanne Brennan
recipes.variant_notes: Same recipe found in both Grandma and MomMom's collections - likely shared clipping
recipes.description: A unique salad with grated carrots and dates in a creamy Gorgonzola dressing.

ingredients.item: Gorgonzola, Maytag or other blue cheese
dandelion, arugula or young lettuce leaves

instructions.text: Using a vegetable peeler or paring knife, peel the carrots. Grate them on the large holes of a hand-held grater to make 1 cup. Set aside.
Chop the dates into pieces about the size of corn kernels and set them aside as well.
In a bowl, combine cheese, olive oil, vinegar and pepper, mashing and whisking the cheese to make a thick dressing.
Add carrots and dates to dressing and turn them until they are well-coated.
Transfer to a serving bowl or to individual salad plates and garnish with dandelion, arugula or lettuce. Serve at once.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for dandelion, arugula or young lettuce leaves

recipes.title: Cauliflower Layer Salad
recipes.attribution: Evelyn Bell
recipes.description: A layered vegetable salad with cauliflower, lettuce, and Parmesan cheese.

instructions.text: In a 9x12 inch dish: Use 1 layer of broken pieces of lettuce, 1 layer of cauliflower pieces, 1 layer of red onion, 1 layer of frozen peas, and 1 layer Parmesan cheese (grated).
Seal top with approximately 2 cups mayonnaise.
Set in refrigerator for overnight.
Toss when ready to serve.

notes: Make ahead - refrigerate overnight

assumptions: Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Cherry Cream Cheese Salad
recipes.attribution: Beverly Olson
recipes.description: A sweet gelatin salad with pineapple, cherries, and cream cheese.

instructions.text: Heat slowly pineapple, sugar, and gelatin.
Cool completely.
Add cherries, cherry juice, softened cream cheese, and Cool Whip. Nuts are optional.
Let set in refrigerator until firm.

notes: Heat pineapple mixture thoroughly to begin thickening; it will thicken more when cooled

assumptions: Used standard can size (1.5 cups) for crushed pineapple
Estimated 6 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Coleslaw
recipes.attribution: Celeste Cochran
recipes.description: Classic creamy coleslaw with celery and mustard seed.

instructions.text: Mix spices, sugar, vinegar, and Miracle Whip and let stand in refrigerator a couple of hours before serving.
Then pour over shredded cabbage and carrot.
Can also be used for potato salad - just add eggs, pickles, etc.

notes: Dressing can be used for potato salad too

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Cranberry Salad
recipes.description: A festive gelatin salad with cranberry, pineapple, and sour cream.

instructions.text: [INFERRED] Dissolve Jell-O in boiling water.
[INFERRED] Add frozen berries, pineapple, and cranberry sauce.
[INFERRED] Pour half into mold, chill until set.
[INFERRED] Spread sour cream over set layer.
[INFERRED] Top with remaining gelatin mixture and nuts.
[INFERRED] Chill until firm.

notes: Recipe continues on next page - instructions partially inferred

assumptions: Assumed 1.5 cup can for whole cranberry sauce
Estimated 8 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Broccoli Mushroom Salad
recipes.description: Fresh broccoli and mushroom salad with a tangy homemade dressing.

instructions.text: Wash and slice fresh mushrooms. Break off florets from head of broccoli.
Combine with chopped onions.
[INFERRED] Combine dressing ingredients and toss with vegetables.

notes: Recipe continues on next page - dressing directions partially inferred

assumptions: Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Broccoli Salad
recipes.attribution: Carol Wynn
recipes.description: Classic broccoli salad with bacon, raisins, and sweet dressing.

instructions.text: Combine broccoli, bacon, raisins, and red onion.
Combine mayonnaise, sugar, and vinegar to form a sauce and pour over the salad.
Chill overnight.

assumptions: Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Marinated Broccoli
recipes.attribution: Elaine Greene
recipes.description: Fresh vegetable salad marinated in a tangy herb dressing.

instructions.text: Mix together vinegar, dill weed, salt, sugar, oil, marjoram, garlic, Accent, and pepper and refrigerate.
Combine broccoli, cauliflower, tomatoes, and mushrooms.
Pour dressing over vegetables and marinate.

assumptions: Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: 3 Bean Salad
recipes.attribution: Susan Roebuck
recipes.description: Classic three bean salad - a great grandmother's recipe!

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients together.
Store overnight in refrigerator.

notes: This was my great grandmother's recipe

assumptions: Used standard can size (1.75 cups) for kidney beans
Used standard can size (1.75 cups) for wax beans
Used standard can size (1.75 cups) for green beans
Estimated 6 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Taco Salad
recipes.attribution: Pat Mallett
recipes.description: Classic taco salad with crushed Doritos and Catalina dressing.

instructions.text: Put lettuce in bowl. Arrange other items in rings on top of lettuce.
Add Doritos and salad dressing immediately before serving.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Turkey Fruit Salad
recipes.attribution: Inga Van Dorple
recipes.description: A fine main course for luncheon or supper - turkey with grapes and pineapple.

instructions.text: Toss ingredients together lightly; chill and serve.

notes: A fine main course for luncheon or supper!

recipes.title: Red, White, and Blue Salad
recipes.attribution: Carol Willison
recipes.description: Patriotic layered gelatin salad with strawberry, cream, and blueberry layers.

instructions.text: Dissolve 1 package strawberry jello in 2 cups boiling water. Pour in 3 quart glass bowl; refrigerate until firmly set.
Dissolve unflavored gelatin in 1/2 cup cold water; set aside.
Dissolve sugar in whipping cream over low heat until nearly boiling. Remove from heat; add gelatin.
Cool. Add sour cream and vanilla; pour over first layer. Refrigerate till firm.
Dissolve raspberry jello in 1 cup boiling water; cool. Add berries and juice.
Pour over second layer. Refrigerate until firm.

notes: This recipe takes a long time but it's worth it!

assumptions: Estimated 8 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Seven Layer Salad
recipes.attribution: Joanne Denton
recipes.description: Classic make-ahead layered salad with peas, bacon, and cheese.

instructions.text: Place lettuce in large glass bowl.
Arrange other ingredients in order given.
Cover and chill. May be prepared a day ahead.

notes: May be prepared a day ahead

recipes.title: Dream Salad
recipes.attribution: Debbie Malick
recipes.description: Light and fluffy orange gelatin salad with cottage cheese and pineapple.

instructions.text: Drain the juice from oranges and pineapple.
Combine all together. Chill and serve.

assumptions: Used standard can size (1.375 cups) for mandarin oranges
Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Frozen Cranberry Salad
recipes.attribution: Karen Griner
recipes.description: Frozen cranberry salad with sweetened condensed milk and Cool Whip.

instructions.text: Combine milk and lemon juice.
Stir in cranberries, pineapple, and nuts.
Fold in Cool Whip.
Spread in 13x9 inch dish and freeze.
Serve on lettuce leaves.

assumptions: Estimated 6 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Fruit Salad
recipes.description: Cooked fruit salad with pineapple glaze, apples, and bananas.

instructions.text: Stir sugar and cornstarch in pan.
Blend in 3/4 cup pineapple juice, lemon juice, and orange peel.
Cook over medium heat, stirring till thickens and boils. Boil 1 minute.
[INFERRED] Cool slightly and pour over fruit.

notes: Recipe continues on next page

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Easy Tuscan Pasta Salad
recipes.attribution: Magazine/product clipping
recipes.source_note: Printed recipe clipping featuring ATHENOS and GOOD SEASONS products
recipes.description: A quick and easy pasta salad with Mediterranean flavors - cherry tomatoes, feta cheese, and sun-dried tomato vinaigrette.

ingredients.item: sun dried tomato vinaigrette with roasted red pepper dressing

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients.
Serve immediately, or cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

notes: MAKE IT A MEAL: Add 2 boneless skinless chicken breast halves, grilled or broiled, cut into 1/4 inch slices

recipes.title: Athenos Greek Salad
recipes.attribution: Magazine/product clipping
recipes.source_note: Printed recipe clipping featuring ATHENOS and KRAFT products
recipes.description: A classic Greek salad with mixed greens, olives, tomatoes, cucumber, and feta cheese.

instructions.text: Toss greens, olives, tomatoes, onion and cucumber in large bowl.
Drizzle with dressing; toss to coat. Sprinkle with cheese.

missing_inputs: Not in database: mixed salad greens
Not in database: Greek vinaigrette dressing

recipes.title: Chef's Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic main-dish salad with meat, cheese, and fresh vegetables.

ingredients.item: fully cooked ham, chicken, turkey, beef, pork, or lamb
cubed Swiss, cheddar, American, provolone, or Gruyère cheese or crumbled blue cheese

ingredients.prep_note: cut into wedges, or 8 cherry tomatoes, halved

ingredients.item: small green or sweet red pepper
Creamy French Dressing, Buttermilk Dressing, Creamy Italian Dressing, or other salad dressing

instructions.text: In a large salad bowl toss together lettuce and romaine or spinach. Arrange meat or poultry, cheese, hard-cooked eggs, tomatoes, pepper rings, and green onions over the greens.
Sprinkle with Croutons, if desired. Pour Creamy French Dressing or other salad dressing over all. Toss to coat. Makes 4 main-dish servings.

Note: To serve Chef's Salad as individual salads, toss together lettuce and romaine or spinach and divide among four individual salad bowls. Top each serving with one-fourth of the meat or poultry, cheese, hard-cooked eggs, tomatoes, pepper rings, and green onions. Sprinkle each with Croutons, if desired. Pass Creamy French Dressing or other salad dressing.

recipes.title: Taco Salads
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Tex-Mex salad served in crispy tortilla cups with seasoned meat and all the fixings.

ingredients.item: ground beef, ground raw turkey, or bulk pork sausage

instructions.text: For meat mixture, in a large skillet cook meat and garlic till meat is no longer pink. Drain off fat. Stir in undrained kidney beans, taco sauce, and chili powder. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover; simmer for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, for salads, combine lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, green pepper, olives, and green onions. Add hot meat mixture. Toss to mix. Divide among Tortilla Cups or individual salad plates.
Garnish with avocado, if desired. Serve with sour cream and additional taco sauce or salsa, if desired. Makes 6 main-dish servings.

Tortilla Cups: In a heavy 3-quart saucepan heat 2 inches cooking oil or melted shortening for deep-fat frying to 375°. Place one 7-inch flour tortilla on top of hot oil. Using a metal ladle, press tortilla into fat, forming the tortilla into a cup. Fry for 40 to 60 seconds or till golden. Remove with tongs. Drain on paper towels. Repeat with five more tortillas.

notes: Microwave directions available for meat mixture

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Caesar Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: The classic anchovy and Parmesan salad with homemade croutons.

ingredients.prep_note: one can, drained, rinsed, and patted dry

instructions.text: Allow egg to come to room temperature. To coddle egg, add egg in shell to a small saucepan of boiling water. Remove from heat; let stand 1 minute. Remove egg from water and cool slightly.

Cut garlic clove in half lengthwise. Rub a large wooden salad bowl with cut sides of the garlic clove. Discard garlic. Add oil, lemon or lime juice, Worcestershire sauce, and hot pepper sauce to bowl. Break the coddled egg into the bowl. Using a fork or a wire whisk, beat till creamy. Add romaine. Toss to coat. Sprinkle with croutons, Parmesan cheese, and pepper; toss to mix. Top with anchovy fillets. Makes 6 side-dish servings.

assumptions: Inferred 0.25 for bottled hot pepper sauce (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Three-Bean Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic marinated bean salad that keeps well in the refrigerator.

ingredients.item: cut wax beans or 8 1/2-ounce can lima beans

instructions.text: Combine wax beans, green beans, red kidney beans, onion, and green pepper. For dressing, in a screw-top jar combine vinegar, oil, sugar, celery seed, and garlic. Cover and shake well. Add to vegetables; stir lightly.
Cover; chill for 4 to 24 hours, stirring often. Makes 6 side-dish servings.

Creamy Three-Bean Salad: Prepare as above, except omit salad oil and sugar. For dressing, combine 1/2 cup mayonnaise or salad dressing, 1 tablespoon vinegar, celery seed, 1 teaspoon prepared mustard, and garlic.

notes: EASY recipe tag in cookbook
Store any leftovers in the refrigerator for up to three days

recipes.title: Coleslaw
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic creamy coleslaw with cabbage and carrots.

ingredients.item: small green or sweet red pepper

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl combine cabbage, carrot, green or sweet red pepper, and green onions. For dressing, stir together mayonnaise or salad dressing, vinegar, sugar, and celery seed. Pour the dressing over the cabbage mixture; toss to coat.
Cover and chill for 1 to 24 hours. Makes 4 side-dish servings.

Vinaigrette Coleslaw: Prepare as above, except substitute vinaigrette for dressing. For vinaigrette, in a screw-top jar combine 1/4 cup vinegar, 3 tablespoons salad oil, 2 to 3 tablespoons sugar, and, if desired, several dashes bottled hot pepper sauce. Cover and shake well.

Nutty Citrus Coleslaw: Prepare as above, except omit green onions. Add 1 small orange, peeled, sliced, and chopped; 1/4 cup chopped walnuts; and 2 tablespoons raisins to the cabbage mixture. Makes 5 side-dish servings.

notes: Variations: Vinaigrette Coleslaw, Nutty Citrus Coleslaw

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Tabbouleh
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: A classic Middle Eastern salad with bulgur (precooked cracked wheat).

instructions.text: Rinse bulgur in a colander with cold water. Drain. Combine bulgur, cucumber, parsley, and onions.
For dressing, in a screw-top jar combine oil, lemon juice, mint, garlic salt, and pepper. Cover; shake to mix. Pour over bulgur mixture. Toss to coat.
Cover and chill 4 to 24 hours. Before serving, stir in tomatoes. Makes 6 side-dish servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Waldorf Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic apple salad with celery, nuts, and creamy dressing.

ingredients.item: raisins or snipped pitted whole dates
whipping cream or 1/3 cup frozen whipped dessert topping, thawed

instructions.text: In a bowl toss apple with lemon juice. Stir in celery, nuts, raisins, and, if desired, grapes.

For dressing, if using whipping cream, in a chilled mixing bowl whip cream to soft peaks. Fold mayonnaise into the whipped cream or dessert topping. Spread dressing over the top of the apple mixture. Sprinkle with nutmeg.
Cover and chill for 2 to 24 hours. To serve, fold dressing into fruit mixture. Makes 4 to 6 side-dish servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Five-Cup Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Simple, sweet fruit salad with coconut and marshmallows.

instructions.text: Drain pineapple chunks, reserving 1 tablespoon syrup. Combine pineapple chunks, reserved syrup, mandarin orange sections, coconut, marshmallows, and sour cream.
Cover and chill for 2 to 24 hours. Before serving, sprinkle with pecans. Makes 6 side-dish servings.

recipes.title: Cranberry Salad
recipes.attribution: Family Recipe

instructions.text: Add juice of pineapple to the unflavored gelatin to dissolve.
Dissolve Jello in hot water, add cold water.
Put cranberries through a food grinder. Add sugar, mix well.
When Jello begins to thicken, fold in cranberry mix and remainder of ingredients.
Pour into a large mold or dish.
Chill until firm.

recipes.title: Bean and Sausage Bowl
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Hearty main-dish salad with sausage, beans, and cheese

ingredients.item: thinly sliced salami, pepperoni, or summer sausage

instructions.text: Cut salami, pepperoni, or summer sausage slices into quarters. In a large bowl toss together meat, lettuce, kidney beans, hard-cooked eggs, celery, cheese, and green onions.
For dressing, stir together mayonnaise or salad dressing, milk, mustard, and horseradish; pour over meat mixture. Toss to coat. Makes 3 main-dish servings.

notes: Marked as FAST recipe

assumptions: Used standard can size (1.75 cups) for red kidney beans

recipes.title: Ham and Rice Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Colorful cold rice salad with ham and vegetables

ingredients.item: cold cooked long grain or brown rice

ingredients.prep_note: see recipe, page 356, or other creamy salad dressing

instructions.text: Cook succotash according to package directions. Drain. In a large bowl stir together succotash, rice, ham, green pepper, tomato, onion, and parsley.
Pour salad dressing over rice mixture. Toss to coat. Cover and chill for 4 to 24 hours. Serve on lettuce-lined salad plates and garnish with sliced egg, if desired. Makes 4 main-dish servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Italian-Style Pasta Toss
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Cold pasta salad with Italian meats, cheese, and vegetables

ingredients.item: chopped green or sweet red pepper

ingredients.prep_note: thinly sliced and separated into rings

instructions.text: Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta. Rinse with cold water; drain again.
For salad, in a bowl toss together pasta, cubed cheese, salami, cauliflower, zucchini, green or red pepper, onion rings, olives, Parmesan cheese, and parsley.

For dressing, in a screw-top jar combine oil, vinegar, garlic, basil, oregano, and pepper. Cover and shake well. Pour over salad. Toss to coat. Cover; chill 4 to 24 hours. To serve, add tomatoes; toss gently. Makes 6 main-dish servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Bratwurst and Pasta Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Hearty pasta salad with bratwurst and Italian seasoning

ingredients.item: cavatelli, medium shell macaroni, or corkscrew macaroni
fresh broccoli or frozen cut broccoli

ingredients.prep_note: see recipe, page 356, or other creamy salad dressing

instructions.text: Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta; rinse with cold water. Drain again. Cut broccoli into 1-inch pieces. Cook broccoli in boiling salted water for 7 to 9 minutes or till crisp-tender. (Or, cook frozen broccoli according to package directions.) Drain.
Toss together pasta, broccoli, bratwurst, tomatoes, and green onions. Stir Italian seasoning into salad dressing. Pour dressing mixture over salad.
Toss to coat. Cover; chill for 4 to 24 hours. Serve over lettuce and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese, if desired. Makes 4 main-dish servings.

missing_inputs: Not in database: fully cooked smoked bratwurst
Not in database: dried Italian seasoning
assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for grated Parmesan cheese (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Reuben Salads
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Deconstructed Reuben sandwich as a salad with rye croutons

instructions.text: Divide lettuce among 4 salad plates. Arrange sauerkraut, beef, cheese, and croutons over lettuce.
Combine salad dressing and caraway seed. Serve with salads. Makes 4 main-dish servings.

Rye Croutons: Brush both sides of 2 slices rye bread with 4 teaspoons softened margarine or butter. Cut into 1/2-inch cubes. In a shallow baking pan spread bread cubes. Bake in a 300° oven for 15 to 18 minutes or till dry, stirring once.

notes: Marked as FAST recipe

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Chicken and Garbanzo Bean Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Southwestern-style chicken salad with beans and chili

ingredients.item: cubed cooked chicken, turkey, or beef
cubed cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese

instructions.text: In a medium bowl combine chicken, garbanzo beans, cheese, celery, green pepper, and green onions.
For dressing, stir together mayonnaise, lemon juice, chili powder, garlic powder, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Stir into chicken mixture.
Cover and chill for 2 to 24 hours. Before serving, stir mixture. Serve on lettuce-lined salad plates. Garnish with tomato wedges. Makes 4 or 5 main-dish servings.

assumptions: Used standard can size (1.75 cups) for garbanzo beans

recipes.title: Chicken Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic chicken salad served in tomato shells

ingredients.item: finely chopped cooked chicken or turkey
ingredients.prep_note: or one 6 3/4-oz can chunk-style chicken, drained

ingredients.item: sweet pickle relish or chopped green pepper

instructions.text: Combine chicken, celery, green onions, lemon juice, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Stir in eggs, mayonnaise, pickle relish, and mustard. Cover; chill at least 1 hour.

Meanwhile, if using tomatoes, cut a thin slice off stem end of each tomato. Using a spoon, scoop out the centers of tomatoes, leaving 1/4- to 1/2-inch-thick shells. Reserve pulp for another use. Serve salad in tomato shells or on lettuce leaves. Makes 4 main-dish servings.

notes: Tuna Salad: Prepare as above, except substitute one 6 1/2-oz can tuna, drained and broken into chunks, for the chicken. Omit mustard.

Salmon Salad: Prepare as above, except substitute one 7 3/4-oz can salmon, drained, flaked, and skin and bones removed, for the chicken. Omit pickle relish and mustard; add 1/2 teaspoon dried dillweed with the eggs.
Ham Salad: Prepare as above, except substitute finely chopped fully cooked ham for the chopped chicken.

recipes.title: Avocado-Shrimp Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Creamy shrimp salad with avocado and cream cheese dressing

instructions.text: For dressing, in a blender container combine avocado, buttermilk, cream cheese, lemon juice, garlic, salt, and hot sauce. Cover and blend till smooth.
Arrange shrimp, tomatoes, and cheese over lettuce. If desired, sprinkle with pepper. Drizzle with dressing. Makes 6 main-dish servings.

assumptions: Inferred 0.25 for bottled hot pepper sauce (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Crab Louis
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic West Coast crab salad with Louis dressing

ingredients.prep_note: 6-oz, thawed, or two 7-oz cans crabmeat, chilled, drained, and cartilage removed

instructions.text: Remove 4 large leaves from lettuce head. Set aside. Tear remaining lettuce into bite-size pieces.
On each of 4 salad plates, place one lettuce leaf. Top with torn lettuce. Reserve four large pieces of crabmeat. Flake remaining crabmeat. Arrange flaked crabmeat, tomatoes, and eggs on lettuce.
Drizzle with Louis Dressing. Sprinkle with paprika. Garnish with the reserved crabmeat and lemon. Makes 4 main-dish servings.

Louis Dressing: Mix 1/2 cup mayonnaise or salad dressing, 1/4 cup finely chopped green pepper, 1/4 cup finely chopped green onion, 2 tablespoons chili sauce, 1 tablespoon milk, 1/2 teaspoon lemon juice, and dash Worcestershire sauce. Beat 1/4 cup whipping cream to soft peaks. Fold whipped cream into mayonnaise mixture.

recipes.title: Salad Niçoise
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic French composed salad with tuna, eggs, and vegetables

ingredients.prep_note: drained, rinsed, and patted dry, optional
see recipe, page 358, or other oil and vinegar salad dressing

instructions.text: Toss together romaine and lettuce. Arrange greens on a large platter. Drain tuna; break tuna into chunks. Mound in center of greens.
Arrange green beans, hard-cooked eggs, potato slices, cherry tomatoes, green pepper, onion, olives, and, if desired, anchovies around tuna. Drizzle with Vinaigrette. Makes 4 main-dish servings.

notes: Salmon Salad Niçoise: Prepare as above, except substitute one 7 3/4-oz can chunk salmon, drained, flaked, and skin and bones removed, for the tuna.

assumptions: Used standard can size (1.0 cups) for chunk white tuna

recipes.title: Salmon Pasta Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Creamy salmon salad with pasta and vegetables

ingredients.item: corkscrew, medium shell, or wagon wheel macaroni

ingredients.prep_note: see recipe, page 356, or other buttermilk salad dressing
15 1/2-oz, drained, flaked, and skin and bones removed

instructions.text: Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain. Immediately transfer hot macaroni to a large bowl. Add cream cheese and Buttermilk Dressing. Toss till the macaroni is coated and mixture is blended.
Stir in milk and dill. Add salmon, cucumber, tomato, and green onions. Toss lightly to mix. Cover and chill for 4 to 24 hours. Makes 6 main-dish servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Gazpacho-Style Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Fresh vegetable salad inspired by Spanish gazpacho soup

ingredients.prep_note: thinly sliced and separated into rings

ingredients.item: snipped fresh basil or dried basil

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl combine tomatoes, cucumber, green pepper, onion, and parsley.
For dressing, in a screw-top jar combine oil, vinegar, sugar, garlic, basil, cumin, mustard, and hot pepper sauce. Cover and shake well. Pour over vegetable mixture; toss lightly to coat.
Cover and chill for 2 to 3 hours, stirring occasionally. Transfer to a salad bowl. Garnish with croutons and avocado slices, if desired. Makes 6 side-dish servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Greens with Basil Vinaigrette
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Mixed greens with apple, mushrooms, and pineapple-basil dressing

ingredients.item: snipped fresh basil or dried basil

instructions.text: For salad, place salad greens in a large salad bowl. Top with apple and mushroom slices.

For vinaigrette, in a screw-top jar combine pineapple juice, vinegar, salad oil, basil, salt, and pepper. Cover and shake well. Drizzle vinaigrette over salad. Toss to mix. Makes 4 side-dish servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Marinated Mushroom Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Fresh mushrooms marinated in tangy herb dressing

instructions.text: For dressing, in a screw-top jar combine lemon juice, salad oil, mustard, sugar, salt, basil, and pepper. Cover and shake well.
Pour dressing over mushrooms; toss to coat. Cover and chill for 4 to 24 hours.
To serve, in a large salad bowl combine lettuce, cherry tomatoes, and carrots. Top with mushroom mixture. Toss to coat all with dressing. Makes 4 to 6 side-dish servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Spinach and Garbanzo Bean Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Fresh spinach salad with beans, vegetables, and avocado dressing

ingredients.prep_note: thinly sliced and separated into rings

instructions.text: For dressing, mash half of the avocado. Stir together mashed avocado, sour cream, lemon juice, celery salt, and hot pepper sauce. Stir in milk till desired consistency. Cover and chill while preparing salad.
For salad, combine spinach, garbanzo beans, tomatoes, cucumber, cauliflower, mushrooms, onion, and walnuts. Slice one hard-cooked egg.

Slice remaining avocado half; brush with additional lemon juice, if desired. Add sliced egg and avocado to salad. Top with dressing; toss to mix. Cut the remaining egg into wedges. Garnish salad with egg wedges. Makes 6 side-dish servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Marinated Vegetable Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Colorful mixed vegetables in herb-oregano marinade

instructions.text: Cook 2 cups small cauliflower flowerets, 2 cups bias-sliced green beans cut into 1-inch pieces, 2 medium carrots, thinly sliced; 1 cup coarsely chopped green pepper; and 1 medium onion, sliced and separated into rings, in a small amount of boiling water for 5 minutes or till crisp-tender.
Drain; transfer to a bowl. Stir in 1 small zucchini, thinly sliced, and 1/4 cup halved pitted ripe olives.

For marinade, in a screw-top jar combine 1/2 cup white wine vinegar; 1/3 cup salad oil; 2 teaspoons sugar; 1 1/2 teaspoons dried oregano, crushed; 1/2 teaspoon salt; and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Cover and shake well. Pour marinade over hot vegetables. Cover; chill for 4 to 24 hours, stirring occasionally. Serve with a slotted spoon. Makes 8 side-dish servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Wilted Spinach Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Warm spinach salad with hot bacon dressing

instructions.text: Combine spinach, mushrooms, and green onion. If desired, sprinkle with pepper. Set aside.

In a 12-inch skillet cook bacon till crisp. Remove bacon, reserving drippings in skillet. Crumble bacon; set aside. Stir vinegar, sugar, and 1/4 teaspoon salt into drippings. Heat to boiling; remove from heat. Add the spinach mixture. Toss till coated.
Transfer to a serving dish. Top with chopped egg and bacon. Serve immediately. Makes 4 side-dish servings.

notes: Microwave directions: Combine spinach, mushrooms, and onion. If desired, sprinkle with pepper. Set aside. In a 2-quart casserole microwave bacon, covered, on 100% power (high) for 3 to 5 minutes or till crisp. Remove bacon, reserving drippings in casserole. Crumble bacon; set aside. Stir vinegar, sugar, and salt into drippings. Cook, covered, for 30 to 45 seconds or till boiling. Add spinach mixture. Toss till coated. Top with chopped egg and bacon. Serve immediately.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Creamy Cucumbers
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Cool cucumber slices in creamy sour cream dressing

ingredients.item: dairy sour cream or plain yogurt

ingredients.prep_note: halved lengthwise and thinly sliced (about 3 cups)
thinly sliced and separated into rings

instructions.text: Stir together sour cream; vinegar; sugar; dillweed, if desired; 1 teaspoon salt and dash pepper.
Add cucumber and onion slices; toss to coat. Cover; chill for 2 to 48 hours, stirring often. Stir before serving. Makes 6 side-dish servings.

notes: Marinated Cucumbers: Prepare as above, except omit sour cream and dillweed. Increase vinegar or lemon juice to 1/4 cup and sugar to 2 tablespoons. If desired, stir 1/2 teaspoon celery seed into vinegar mixture. Cover and chill for 2 hours or up to 5 days, stirring occasionally.

recipes.title: Pea-Cheese Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Colorful salad with peas, cheese, and hard-cooked eggs

ingredients.item: diced pimiento or sweet red pepper

instructions.text: Cook frozen peas according to package directions. Thoroughly drain the cooked or canned peas. Cool cooked peas.
In a large bowl combine peas, cheese cubes, hard-cooked eggs, celery, onion, and pimiento or sweet red pepper. Combine mayonnaise or salad dressing, salt, and pepper. Add to pea mixture; toss to mix.

Cover and chill for 4 to 24 hours. Stir mixture well. If desired, cut each tomato into 8 wedges, cutting to, but not through, the bottom. Place tomatoes atop lettuce. Fill tomatoes with pea mixture. Makes 6 side-dish servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: 24-Hour Vegetable Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Layered make-ahead salad with vegetables, bacon, and cheese

ingredients.item: torn iceberg lettuce, romaine, leaf lettuce, Bibb lettuce, or fresh spinach
sliced fresh mushrooms or broccoli flowerets, or frozen peas
shredded Swiss, American, or cheddar cheese

instructions.text: Place lettuce or spinach in the bottom of a bowl, about 8 inches in diameter. If desired, sprinkle with salt and pepper. Layer mushrooms, broccoli, or peas atop. Then layer carrots. Arrange egg slices and bacon over vegetables.

Top with 1/2 cup of the cheese and the green onions. For dressing, combine mayonnaise, lemon juice, and, if desired, dillweed. Spread dressing over top of salad, sealing to edge of bowl. Sprinkle with remaining cheese.
Cover and chill for 2 to 24 hours. Before serving, toss to coat the vegetables. Sprinkle with additional sliced green onion, if desired. Makes 6 to 8 side-dish servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Carrot-Raisin Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Sweet and crunchy carrot salad with raisins and apples

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl combine carrots, apple, and raisins. Sprinkle with lemon juice.
Add mayonnaise or salad dressing. Stir gently to coat well. Cover and chill for 2 to 24 hours. (If dressing becomes too thick, stir in a little milk.)
Before serving, sprinkle with toasted almonds, if desired. Makes 6 side-dish servings.

recipes.title: Creamy Potato Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic American potato salad with eggs and mustard

instructions.text: In a covered saucepan cook potatoes in boiling water for 20 to 25 minutes or till just tender; drain well. Peel and cube potatoes.
In a very large bowl combine celery, green pepper, onion, mayonnaise or salad dressing, vinegar, mustard, salt, and pepper. Add potatoes and eggs. Toss lightly to mix.
Cover and chill for 6 to 24 hours. Makes 12 side-dish servings.

recipes.title: Marinated Potato Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Elegant potato salad with artichoke hearts and vinaigrette

ingredients.prep_note: see recipe, page 358, or other oil and vinegar dressing

instructions.text: In a covered saucepan cook potatoes in boiling salted water for 15 to 20 minutes or just till tender; drain well. Cut potatoes into quarters.
In a large bowl pour dressing over potatoes. Add artichoke hearts, green pepper, tomatoes, onion, olives, and parsley. Toss gently to mix.
Cover and chill for 4 to 24 hours, stirring occasionally. Transfer to a serving bowl. Garnish with kale leaf, if desired. Makes 4 or 5 side-dish servings.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: German-Style Potato Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Warm potato salad with bacon and tangy dressing

ingredients.prep_note: chopped; 2 slices bacon, cooked, drained, and crumbled, optional

instructions.text: In a covered saucepan cook potatoes in boiling salted water for 20 to 25 minutes or till just tender; drain well. Cool slightly. Peel and slice potatoes. Set aside while preparing dressing.
For dressing, in a large skillet cook 4 slices bacon till crisp. Drain and crumble, reserving 2 tablespoons drippings. Set the bacon aside. Add chopped onion to reserved drippings. Cook till tender.

Stir in flour, sugar, salt, celery seed, and pepper. Stir in water and vinegar. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Stir in potatoes and bacon. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes more or till heated through, stirring gently. Season to taste.
Transfer to a serving bowl. Garnish with hard-cooked egg, parsley, or additional bacon, if desired. Makes 4 side-dish servings.

recipes.title: Cajun-Style Rice Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Spicy rice salad with shrimp and Cajun seasonings

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl gently stir together rice, green pepper, shrimp, mushrooms, hard-cooked egg, and parsley. Set aside.
For dressing, in a screw-top jar combine salad oil, vinegar, water, paprika, horseradish, onion salt, and red pepper. Cover and shake well. Pour dressing over rice mixture. Toss to coat.
Cover and chill for 4 to 24 hours. Serve on lettuce leaves. Makes 6 side-dish servings.

assumptions: Used standard can size (0.5 cups) for shrimp

recipes.title: Barley Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Nutty grain salad with barley, carrots, and lemon

ingredients.item: fresh snipped basil or dried basil
chopped peanuts or cashews, or toasted slivered almonds

instructions.text: In a saucepan combine chicken broth and barley. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 10 to 12 minutes or till liquid is absorbed.
In a mixing bowl combine barley, carrot, and parsley. For dressing, in a screw-top jar combine water, salad oil, lemon juice, basil, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Cover and shake well.
Pour dressing over barley mixture. Toss to coat. Cover and chill for 4 to 24 hours. Stir in nuts before serving. Makes 6 side-dish servings.

recipes.title: Cinnamon Fruit Salad
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Warm fruit salad with cinnamon-apricot dressing

instructions.text: For dressing, in a blender container or food processor bowl place undrained apricots. Cover and blend or process till smooth.
In a saucepan combine blended apricots, sugar, lemon juice, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove cinnamon.
Meanwhile, in a mixing bowl stir together orange slices and pineapple chunks. Add dressing; stirring carefully to coat. Cover and chill for several hours.
Just before serving, stir in strawberry halves. Spoon fruit mixture onto 6 lettuce-lined plates. If desired, garnish with fresh mint sprigs. Makes 6 side-dish servings.

assumptions: Assumed 1.5 cup can for unpeeled apricot halves
Used standard can size (1.5 cups) for pineapple chunks
Assumed 1 unit for fresh mint sprigs

recipes.title: Fruit-Filled Melons
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Cantaloupe bowls filled with fresh fruit and ginger dressing

instructions.text: Cut each cantaloupe in half and remove the seeds. Use a melon baller to scoop out pulp, reserving shells. Set aside 2 cups melon balls; reserve remaining melon for another use. Trim a thin slice from the bottom of each melon shell.
In a bowl mix the 2 cups melon balls, orange, apple, peach, blueberries, and strawberries. For dressing, stir together yogurt, mayonnaise, brown sugar, and gingerroot.
Line each melon shell with lettuce leaves. Divide fruit among melon shells. Top each with one fourth of the dressing. Makes 4 side-dish servings.
Note: If desired, sprinkle with lemon juice to keep fruit from darkening (see tip, page 351).

recipes.title: Green Chile Salad
recipes.attribution: Green Chile Bible

instructions.text: Combine the vinegar and salad oil. Rub a bowl with the cut garlic and add the diced tomato, onion, and green chiles. Let stand 5 minutes.
Add the vinegar and salad oil and toss gently. Serve on leaves or in the center of scoops of small curd cottage cheese.

recipes.title: Marinated Garden Salad
recipes.attribution: Green Chile Bible

instructions.text: Toss together the tomatoes, green chiles, onions, and lemon slices.
Add oil, vinegar, salt, pepper, and oregano. Cover and marinate in refrigerator at least 2 hours.
At serving time, remove the lemon slices and serve the salad in lettuce cups.

recipes.title: Piquant Salad
recipes.attribution: Green Chile Bible

instructions.text: Dissolve the gelatin in 1 cup hot water in an 8 X 10-inch pan.
When lightly thickened, add the remaining ingredients. Chill.

recipes.title: Green Chile and Cucumber Salad
recipes.attribution: Green Chile Bible

instructions.text: Dissolve the gelatin according to the package directions. Stir in the remaining ingredients.
Place 12 large paper baking cups in muffin tins and spoon the gelatin mixture into cups in muffin tins.

recipes.title: Salad Joshua
recipes.attribution: Cooking With the Ancients

instructions.text: Brown pine nuts over medium heat, stirring continuously, about 2 minutes. Set aside.

Tear lettuce into bite-sized pieces. Place in bowl and add pine nuts, feta cheese, and grapes. In a separate small bowl dissolve salt in lemon juice. Whisk in olive oil and taste for seasoning. Drizzle over salad, toss, and serve.

recipes.title: Lotta Lentils
recipes.attribution: Cooking With the Ancients

ingredients.item: mixed herbs: mint, basil, and thyme

instructions.text: Whisk together lemon juice and olive oil. Beat in herbs and garlic.
Wash lentils and boil in a quart of water until tender, about 30 minutes. Drain. While warm, toss with lemon dressing. Cool to room temperature.
Add celery. Serve immediately or chill and serve cold.

recipes.title: Chicken Salad
recipes.attribution: Cooking With the Ancients

ingredients.prep_note: boiled following Chicken Pilaf recipe, cooled and diced

instructions.text: Boil chicken, following recipe in Chapter 7 for Chicken Pilaf. Dice cooked, cooled chicken.
Mix with homemade mayonnaise, halved grapes (or black olives), chopped walnuts, and/or pine nuts.
Season with sage, basil, and salt. Taste and adjust seasonings.

recipes.title: Juliuth Icthus Salad
recipes.attribution: Cooking With the Ancients
recipes.description: A Caesar-style salad with homemade croutons

instructions.text: For croutons: Use slightly stale bread. Remove the crusts, then cut slices of bread into cubes. Sauté in hot butter or olive oil. Add minced clove of garlic when all sides of the bread have browned, taking care not to let the garlic burn.
In a blender, combine the olive oil and garlic. Blend until creamy. Add the lemon juice and salt.
Pour the dressing into a large salad bowl. Add the anchovies and mash into the dressing.
Wash and dry the lettuce leaves, discarding any that are blemished. Tear into bite-sized pieces.
Add to the salad bowl and toss until the leaves are coated. Add the croutons and toss lightly.
Just before serving, add the cheese.

recipes.title: More Cucumber Salad
recipes.attribution: Cooking With the Ancients

instructions.text: In small bowl, combine the yogurt, scallions, dill, salt, and mustard powder. Blend.
Add thinly sliced cucumbers and mix well to coat with dressing.
Place 2 or 3 dill sprigs on top. Cover tightly and refrigerate for one hour.
Before serving, remove dill.

recipes.title: Cress Salad
recipes.attribution: Foxfire 2
recipes.source_note: Traditional Appalachian salad from The Foxfire Book 2
recipes.description: A fresh salad using wild water cress.

instructions.text: Toss together lightly: two cups finely cut cresses, one-fourth teaspoon salt, one tablespoon salad oil, one tablespoon vinegar, one tablespoon French dressing.

notes: Can also chop and add hard-boiled egg

recipes.title: Mixed Wild Green Salad
recipes.attribution: Foxfire 2
recipes.description: A raw salad of wild spring greens with garlic dressing.

instructions.text: Take equal parts of dandelion, shepherd's purse, peppergrass, curly dock, poke shoots (must be cooked first), and sorrel. Chop fine.
Add wild onion to taste.
Make a dressing of oil and vinegar, and flavor with garlic, mustard, salt, and pepper.
Serve on a bed of wild dock or lettuce leaves.

notes: Poke shoots MUST be cooked before adding to raw salad

recipes.title: Wilted Greens with Hot Bacon Dressing
recipes.attribution: Foxfire 2
recipes.description: Wild greens wilted with hot bacon and vinegar dressing.

instructions.text: Fry bacon until crisp.
Add vinegar and salt to the hot bacon grease.
Pour over the greens and toss.

recipes.title: Wild Lettuce Salad
recipes.attribution: Traditional Appalachian, via Foxfire 2
recipes.source_note: Traditional wild food recipe from Foxfire Book 2
recipes.description: Fresh salad made with wild lettuce and hot bacon dressing.

instructions.text: Cut up wild lettuce greens and wash.
Cut green onions in it.
Fry bacon until crisp and crumbly.
Add brown sugar and vinegar to the hot bacon grease.
Pour hot dressing over the chopped wild lettuce leaves.
For extra flavor, add chickweed or mustard.

notes: Gather wild lettuce in early spring when plants are young.
Older plants get tough and wormy.
Wild lettuce has a milky juice when stems are broken.

recipes.title: Appalachian Ramp Salad
recipes.attribution: Foxfire Book 2
recipes.description: Fresh wild ramp salad with multiple serving variations.

instructions.text: Chop up young ramp leaves into tiny bits.
Eat raw, or cook and add vinegar when ready to eat.
Alternatively, add a little to any salad.
Or chop fine, parboil, drain and cool, and mix with mayonnaise and serve with trout.

notes: You can also add one-half cup chopped fine to mashed potatoes just before serving.

recipes.title: Swamp Cabbage Slaw (Heart of Palm)
recipes.attribution: Eat the Weeds - Green Deane (from Marian Van Atta's Wild Edibles)
recipes.description: Simple slaw made from fresh heart of palm.

instructions.text: Optionally soak shredded palm hearts in ice water for an hour.
Mix with mayonnaise and pickle relish.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.

recipes.title: Amaranth Tabouli
recipes.attribution: Eat the Weeds - Green Deane
recipes.description: Middle Eastern-style grain salad made with amaranth instead of bulgur.

instructions.text: Simmer amaranth in equal volume of water for 12-15 minutes and cool completely.
Combine all ingredients except lettuce and olives in a bowl, tossing gently.
Refrigerate at least one hour to blend flavors.
Line a serving bowl with washed, dried lettuce leaves.
Add the amaranth mixture and garnish with olives.

notes: Soak amaranth overnight in water to reduce saponin content before cooking

recipes.title: Bitter Melon Salad (Philippine Style)
recipes.attribution: Eat the Weeds - Green Deane
recipes.description: Fresh Philippine-style bitter melon salad with tomatoes.

instructions.text: Halve gourds lengthwise and scoop out seeds with a spoon.
Cut into half-moon pieces and toss with salt; let sit to remove bitterness.
Slice tomatoes into wedges and onion thinly.
Rinse salt from melon and combine with tomatoes and onions.
Dress with vinaigrette and chill before serving.

recipes.title: Nasturtium Bouquet Salad
recipes.attribution: Eat the Weeds - Green Deane
recipes.description: Elegant salad with radicchio, spinach, and nasturtium blossoms.

instructions.text: Whisk vinegar and mustard together in a bowl.
Gradually add oils while whisking. Add lime juice and zest.
Season with salt and pepper.
Just before serving, toss greens, chives, and flowers with sufficient dressing to coat.

recipes.title: Codium Salad
recipes.attribution: Eat the Weeds
recipes.description: A refreshing raw seaweed salad with Asian-inspired dressing.

instructions.text: Mix all dressing ingredients (soy sauce, wine vinegar, sugar, sherry, and black pepper) together.
Pour the dressing over chopped onions.
Just before serving, chop the tomatoes and codium into bite-sized pieces.
Toss the chopped tomatoes and seaweed with the dressed onions.
Garnish with tomato slices.
Chill before serving.

notes: Never cook codium - it becomes soft and disintegrates from heat
Always eat raw after thorough washing

recipes.title: Sea Blite and Sour Cream Salad
recipes.attribution: Eat the Weeds
recipes.description: A creamy salad featuring foraged sea blite with hard-boiled eggs.

ingredients.item: sea blite leaves, stems, or flowers

instructions.text: Cook sea blite in boiling water until tender, then drain and chop.
Combine all ingredients in a bowl and mix well.
Refrigerate for two hours before serving.

notes: Sea blite is naturally salty, so taste before adding salt
Also known as Suaeda
